page.title: 09SEDGEFIELD EDUCATION
page.content: ALL THE CHILDREN STAY A YEAR IN EVERY CLASS IN THE INFANT AND JUNIOR SCHOOLS.WHEN THEY REACH THE TOP CLASS THEY ARE ELEVEN YEARS OLD.AT THIS AGE THEYGET ALL THE JOBS LIKE SERVING THE DINNERS,WASHING UP AND DOORS. WHEN THE CHILDREN HAVE HAD A FULL YEAR IN THE TOP CLASS THEY MOVE UP INTO THE SECONDRY SCHOOL. IN OUR SCHOOL{SEDGEFIELD HARDWICK THERE ARE 169 PUPILS IN THE OTHER PRIMARY SCHOOL IN SEDGEFIELD,{ { SEDGEFIELD COUNTY}THERE ARE ABOUT 250 PUPILS. AT THE AGE OF ELEVEN PUPILS THEN MOVE ON TO THE COMPREHENSIVE SCHOOL{SEDGEFIELD COMMUNITY {COLLEGE.}THIS LASTS UNTIL THE CHILD IS 16 YEARS OLD.PUPILS CAN STUDY FOR 'O',AND 'A' LEVELS. PUPILS COME FROM FISHBURN,TRIMDON AND OTHER PLACES.
